FuncDef: The display nat flow-defend command displays the configured rate at which the first packet is sent to create a flow on a NAT device.
CLIs: display nat flow-defend { forward | reverse | fragment } rate slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ]
display nat flow-defend { forward | reverse | fragment } rate slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the rate at which the first user-to-network packet is sent to create a flow on a NAT device.
-

Displays the rate at which the first network-to-user packet is sent to create a flow on a NAT device.
-

Displays the rate at which the first fragment is sent to create a flow on a NAT device.
-

Indicates the rate (kpps) at which the first packet or fragment is sent to create a flow on a NAT device.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is an integer equal 0 for VSUF-80.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1 for VSUF-160,VSUI-160-E,VSUI-400A/VSUI-400.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3 for VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-E.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display nat flow-defend forward rate slot 1 engine 0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view the configured rate at which the first packet or fragment is sent to create a flow on a NAT device, run the display nat flow-defend command on a specified service board.
Follow-up Procedure
If the displayed rate delays the establishment of a NAT session table, run the nat flow-defend command to increase the rate.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
